result.execSummary:
The defendant Travoris M Walton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Escape-Criminal Arrest, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.42(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered the defendant to pay all costs, fees and surcharges during the period of supervision on case 10CF2676. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Travoris M Walton

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter from the defendant received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Travoris M Walton in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Defendant Travoris M Walton in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp on behalf of James Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea and sentencing hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Plea hearing proceeded.
Defendant sworn in.

As to COUNT 1-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing and pay a DNA surcharge.
Letters on behalf of the defendant received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Attorney Andrew Joel Golden in court, defendant Travoris M Walton not in court, in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for scheduling conference. Parties advise the court they are still in negotiations and completing further investigation into the defendant's custodial status at the time of the alleged offense. Defense counsel requested a plea and sentencing date. Discussion regarding defense counsel's motion for extension of time to provide information related to the defendant's custodial status. State does not object. Court granted defense request. Any motions are due by 10/02/15. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Motion to Extend the Court's Deadline to Provide Information Related to Defendant's Custody received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Certification of PRELIMINDARY HEARING transcript commencing 08/14/2015 received and filed. (26 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to STEPHANIE SHOATE, OFFICIAL COURT REPORTER, CJF, 949 N. 9TH ST., RM. G-55, MILWAUKEE, WI 53233. mt

Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Department of Corrections Agent Yvette Farris.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Court granted defense request for adjourned scheduling date. Defense to file a bail motion by 9/1/15. Case is adjourned to Branch 25.

Defendant Travoris M Walton in court with attorney Andrew Golden.  Deann L Heard on behalf of James Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for preliminary hearing. Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Pocan.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Rothstein, Br. 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Travoris M Walton in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  Defendant Travoris M Walton in custody.  
Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26.    Motion to dismiss by defense argued and DENIED by the Court. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  

Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Travoris M Walton
Current: 812 S 11th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53204 United States  (Effective: 08-08-2015)
Prior: 2022 S 12th St, Milwaukee, WI 53204 United States
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
